pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:4.1: 12. The training rule on bad behavior
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:5.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:5.2: At that time the nuns who were pupils of the nun Thullanandā were constantly socializing, were behaving badly, and had a bad reputation, and they were harassing the Order of nuns and hiding one another’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.2: “How can those nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.3: “Is it true, monks, that nuns are acting like this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.6: How can nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:6.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.1: ‘If nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.2: then the nuns should correct them in this way:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.3: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.4: Be secluded, Venerables. The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.5: If those nuns still continue as before, the nuns should press them up to three times to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.6: If they then stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:7.7: If not, then those nuns too have committed a third-time offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:8.2: what is meant is that they are fully ordained.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:9.2: they constantly socialize with improper bodily and verbal action.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:11.2: a bad reputation has spread about them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:12.2: they make a living by means of a bad and wrong livelihood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:13.2: they protest on each other’s behalf when legal procedures are being carried out against them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:16.2: Other nuns, those who see it or hear about it. They should say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.2: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.3: Be secluded, Venerables. The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.4: And they should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.6: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.7: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.8: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.9: Those nuns, even if they have to be dragged into the middle of the Order, should be spoken to thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.10: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.11: Be secluded, Venerables. The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.12: They should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.14: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.15: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.17: “And, monks, they should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:17.18: A competent and capable nun should inform the Order:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:18.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:18.2: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:18.4: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should press them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:19.1: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:19.2: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:19.4: The Order presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:19.5: Any nun who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:19.6: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:20.1: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:20.2: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:21.1: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so have been pressed by the Order to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:21.2: The Order approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:22.1: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:22.2: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:22.3: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:22.4: If they commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:22.5: Two or three may be pressed at once, but not more than that.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:23.2: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:24.2: there is an offense when they have been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:25.2: they are sent away from the Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:26.2: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:27.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:27.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:27.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:28.1: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:28.2: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:28.3: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:29.2: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:29.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:30.1: The twelfth offense entailing suspension is finished.
